title: Estádio Carlos Osório
text:
Estádio Carlos Osório is a <a href="stadium">stadium</a> in <a href="Oliveira%20de%20Azem%C3%A9is%20%28parish%29">Oliveira de Azeméis</a>, <a href="Aveiro%20District">Aveiro</a>, <a href="Portugal">Portugal</a>. It is currently used for <a href="association%20football">football</a> matches and is the home ground of <a href="Liga%20de%20Honra">Liga de Honra</a> side <a href="U.D.%20Oliveirense">U.D. Oliveirense</a>. The ground holds a <a href="seating%20capacity">seating capacity</a> of 4000. The stadium is named after a local villager called Carlos Osório who gave permission to the club to construct the stadium on his piece of land. 
Following Oliveirense's promotion from the <a href="Portuguese%20Second%20Division">Portuguese Second Division</a> to the <a href="Liga%20de%20Honra">Liga de Honra</a> in the 2007–08 season, the <a href="Portuguese%20League%20for%20Professional%20Football">LPFP</a> instructed the club to remodel the stadium as well as renovate it due to the professional league criteria requiring better pitch conditions.
